settings.title: Our Locations
settings.text: Flourist is first and foremost a Vancouver-based flour miller and dry goods brand. Our mission is to connect consumers to better ingredients by sharing the tools, education and community people need to access, cook and eat nutritious, whole food. Founded in 2014 by Janna Bishop and Shira McDermott, Flourist started out as a wholesale supplier to Vancouver's restaurant scene. Our team has grown since those early days and so have the ways you can get our products.

settings.title: 3433 Commercial Street
settings.text:
The Flourist Bakery on Commercial Street is our flagship retail location. Opening in August of 2019, it is the first bakery in Vancouver to exclusively use flour stone milled on site.

Our bakery on Commercial Street offers artisan coffees and plenty of seating, as well as our full range of bread, pastry, and lunch options including our grain salads and sandwiches. We offer a curated selection of local beverages, grocery items, kitchen tools and more. Customers are invited to eat, shop, take classes, and enjoy the beautiful design of our shaker-inspired space designed by local design studio Ste. Marie Studio.

settings.title: Shop Online
settings.text: Visit our shops for lunch, your daily bread, or for baking and cooking essentials. Place an order the day before for pickup and take advantage of our full assortment of premium grocery items.

settings.html:
We bake using freshly milled flour milled in-house exclusively. We don't use any white flour in any of our baking. 

In addition to freshly milled flour and our premium dry goods for your home pantry, the Flourist Mill + Bakery serves our favourite things to eat. The menu is inspired by the foods we ate and enjoyed in our childhoods, from our grandmothers' prairie kitchens to our family dinner tables. This is the food we want to eat everyday and we hope you will too. We've taken great care to source the best ingredients we can find. With full transparency in mind, we've chosen partners that truly share our values of premium quality and traceability.
Eating with us means you are supporting many locally owned small businesses, working to create better products for everyone. When sourcing, we ask all of our suppliers the following questions: Can it be traced to the exact source? Who owns the company? Is it a family run business? What is the company's stance on the environment? Does it have a diverse workforce?

settings.title: 859 East Hastings
settings.text: Our Strathcona location is an easy to access retail experience for the local community, or those looking to visit our main headquarters. Shop flour, dry goods, our best-selling prepared foods, curated grocery items, and kitchen tools.

settings.title: Can I order online and pickup at both locations?
settings.text: Yes! Select pickup at either of our locations for pickup the next day. Commercial Street pickup hours are 12PM-5PM and Strathcona pickup hours are 11AM-4PM.

settings.title: Do you serve coffee at Strathcona?
settings.text: Unfortunately we only serve coffee at Commercial Street. Strathcona offers pastries, bread, shopping, grab and go lunch options, but does not have seating or coffee.

settings.title: Do you have parking?
settings.text: We have 3 spots available for customers behind our Commercial Street location, and there is lots of free parking in the neighbourhood. Strathcona has plenty of free parking out front.

settings.title: Can I buy flour at both locations?
settings.text: Yes you can! No pre-orders are necessary. You can shop all of our flours in the fridges at both locations. If you wish to pre-order for pickup, local delivery, or for shipping, that is also an option.
